tn.text: Solomon talks with King Hiram about building the Temple.
"Hiram had always been a close friend of King David" (UDB)

tn.ref: Yahweh was putting his enemies under the soles of his feet
tn.text: To put an enemy under someone's foot means to conquer them. AT: "Yahweh was helping David to defeat his enemies" or "David was busy since Yahweh was giving him victory over his enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

The word "name" is a metonym for the person, and "for the name" refers to worshiping the person.Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:03:01|3:2]]. AT: "in which people would worship Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: because of the wars that surrounded him
tn.text: Another possible meaning is "because of the wars with which his enemies surrounded him" or "because he was fighting enemies on all sides"

tn.ref: Yahweh was putting his enemies under the soles of his feet
tn.text: The soles of the feet are a metonym for complete control over a person. AT: "Yahweh was enabling David to completely defeat his enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Solomon continues to talk with King Hiram about building the Temple.

tn.ref: has given me rest on every side
tn.text: Before Solomon became king, King David and the people of Israel had been at war, but now King Solomon and the people were at rest and in a time of peace.

tn.ref: There is neither adversary nor disaster
tn.text: neither humans who cause harm nor natural events that cause harm. This can be stated positively. AT: "We are safe from our enemies and from natural disasters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
enemy
event that causes harm to people and their property
This is to emphasize the words that follow. "Listen! This is what I am going to do:" or "Because of what Yahweh has done for me, this is what I am going to do:"

tn.ref: for the name of Yahweh my God ... for my name
tn.text: The word "name" is a metonym for the person. AT: "where Yahweh my God will live ... where I will live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: set on your throne in your place
tn.text: Here "throne" refers to ruling as king. AT: "make to be the king after you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Solomon continues to talk with King Hiram about building the temple.

tn.ref: there is no one among us who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians
tn.text: "your workers know how to cut timber better than my men"
"people of Sidon"
King Hiram answers Solomon.
"what Solomon said"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "I praise Yahweh today" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Cypress is another kind of valuable wood that would be used for building the temple.
King Hiram continues to answer Solomon.
"tie them together so they will float in groups"
This can be translated in active form. AT: "my workers untie the logs from each other" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You will do what I desire
tn.text: "You can do what I want" or "You can pay me"
The word "fir" refers to many kinds of trees, including cypress trees.
This was a dry measurement whereas the oil was a liquid measurement. It was not clear which measure was intended. The UDB takes an educated guess. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
"every year"
Solomon forces men to build the Temple.

tn.ref: conscripted labor out of all Israel
tn.text: "forced men from all over Israel to work"
That is, there were three groups that took turns spending one month in Lebanon and two months at home.

tn.ref: One month they were in Lebanon and two months at home
tn.text: Each of the three groups spent one month working in Lebanon and then two months at home in Israel.

tn.ref: the men who were subjected to forced labor
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the men whom Solomon was forcing to work for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Solomon continues to force men to build the Temple.
"heavy things"
"men who dug stones out of the ground and cut them"
Solomon continues to force men to build the temple.

tn.ref: quarried large stones of high quality
tn.text: "dug large, good stones out of the mountain and cut them to be the right shape"
men from the city of Gebal (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
